00004 /*! \file cvm-oct-dev.h
00005     \brief  Core Driver: Octeon device structure for core driver 
00006  */
00007 
00008 
00009 #ifndef __CVM_OCT_DEV_H__
00010 #define __CVM_OCT_DEV_H__
00011 
00012 /* CN63XX & CN68XX supports upto 8 queues.
00013    CN56XX supports upto 5 dma queues. We'll save space for the max.
00014    possible. */
00015 #define   MAX_DMA_QS            8
00016 
00017 /* Max number of cores in a 56xx */
00018 #define   CN56XX_MAX_CORES           12
00019 
00020 
00021 
00022 #define   CVM_DRV_INIT    1
00023 #define   CVM_DRV_READY   2
00024 #define   CVM_DRV_RESET   3
00025 
00026 #define   CVM_DRV_PKO_STOP  0
00027 #define   CVM_DRV_PKO_READY 1
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031 #define   MAX_OPCODES                32
00032 
00033 //#define   DMA_CHUNK_LOCK_USE_TAG
00034 
00035 
00036 #define   CVM_PCI_DMA_CHUNK_TAG(i)    (0x11001100 + i)
00037 
00038 
00039 /** Core: The PCI DMA uses instruction chunks to read the DMA instructions
00040  *  posted by the driver. The chunks are a chained list of fixed-size
00041  *  buffers. This structure is used solely by the PCI core driver.
00042  */
00043 typedef struct {
00044 
00045 #ifdef  DMA_CHUNK_LOCK_USE_TAG
00046   uint32_t            tag;
00047   uint32_t            resvd_lock;
00048 #else
00049   /** Lock to control access to this structure. */
00050   cvmx_spinlock_t     lock;
00051 #endif
00052 
00053   /** Address of the current instruction chunk. */
00054   uint64_t            *buf;
00055 
00056   /** Size of chunk in the PCI DMA instruction chunked list. */
00057   uint32_t             chunk_size;
00058 
00059   /** The current offset into the current chunk where the next DMA
00060       instruction word is written by host. */
00061   uint32_t             current_word;
00062 
00063   /** Total words that can be written in the chunk's free space.  */
00064   uint32_t             total_free_words;
00065 
00066   /** Maximum words that can be written in this chunk. max_words = 
00067       (chunk_size / word_size(8 bytes)) - 1 (for next pointer). */
00068   uint32_t             max_words;
00069 
00070   uint64_t             doorbell_reg;
00071 
00072   /** An extra buffer allocated so that chunks can be quickly chained. */
00073   uint64_t             extra_buf;
00074 
00075   /** The pool from which the chunks are allocated by driver.
00076       The Hardware frees them to the same pool. */
00077   uint32_t             pool;
00078 
00079 }  cvm_oct_dma_chunk_t;
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083 /** Core: Software defined PCI DMA Completion byte pool buffer format. */ 
00084 typedef struct {
00085     uint8_t   comp_byte;
00086     uint8_t   in_use;
00087 } cvm_dma_comp_ptr_t;
00088 
00089 /*
00090    Core driver allocates an array of type cvm_dma_comp_ptr_t as a free pool of
00091    completion pointer bytes. Application can call a function to get the next
00092    available comp_ptr_t. It can use the comp_byte as a completion byte to be
00093    passed to the DMA hardware. The in_use field is used by the core driver to
00094    keep track of the entries in the free pool.
00095 */
00096 
00097 #define CVM_DMA_COMP_PTR_SIZE   (sizeof(cvm_dma_comp_ptr_t))
00098 
00099 #define CVM_DMA_COMP_PTR_COUNT  1024
00100 #define CVM_DMA_COMP_POOL_SIZE  (CVM_DMA_COMP_PTR_COUNT * CVM_DMA_COMP_PTR_SIZE)
00101 
00102 
00103 /** Core: Structure to manage software defined Completion byte buffer pool. */
00104 typedef  struct {
00105 
00106     /** Lock for the completion words free pool. */
00107     cvmx_spinlock_t         lock;
00108 
00109     /** The completion byte pool. */
00110     cvm_dma_comp_ptr_t     *list;
00111 
00112     /** The next entry in the completion byte free pool. */
00113     uint32_t                idx;
00114 
00115 } cvm_oct_comp_ptr_pool_t;
00116 
00117 
00118 
00119 /** Core: Octeon PKO port and queue numbers corressponding to Octeon PCI output
00120    queues. */
00121 struct __cvm_pci_pko_qmap {
00122 
00123     uint8_t    active;
00124     uint8_t    rsvd[3];
00125     uint16_t   port;
00126     uint16_t   queue;
00127 };
00128 
00129 
00130 
00131 
00132 /** Core: Structure that maintains information for the Octeon device in the
00133           core driver. */
00134 typedef struct {
00135 
00136     /** Current core driver state */
00137     uint8_t                      state;
00138 
00139     /** Current software global PKO state */
00140     uint8_t                      pko_state;
00141 
00142     /** Clock ticks per microsecond. */
00143     uint16_t                     clocks_per_us;
00144 
00145 
00146     /** This octeon device's id. Given to Octeon by the host driver. */
00147     uint8_t                      dev_id;
00148 
00149     /** The interface number for the PCI ports */
00150     uint8_t                      npi_if;
00151 
00152     uint8_t                      reserved[3];
00153 
00154 
00155     /** Max DMA engines in this Octeon device. */
00156     uint8_t                      max_dma_qs;
00157 
00158     /** Max local pointers supported by this Octeon device DMA engine. */
00159     uint8_t                      max_lptrs;
00160 
00161     /** Max remote pointers supported by this Octeon device DMA engine. */
00162     uint8_t                      max_rptrs;
00163 
00164     /** Sum of local and remote pointers */
00165     uint8_t                      max_dma_ptrs;
00166 
00167 
00168 
00169     struct __cvm_pci_pko_qmap   *pcipkomap;
00170 
00171     /** Address of the next chunk for each DMA engine. */
00172     cvm_oct_dma_chunk_t         *chunk[MAX_DMA_QS];
00173 
00174     /** Address of the completion byte software pool. */
00175     cvm_oct_comp_ptr_pool_t     *comp_ptr;
00176 
00177     /** Lookup table for opcodes. */
00178     int                         (*optable[MAX_OPCODES])(cvmx_wqe_t *);
00179 
00180 
00181 
00182     /** BAR0 PCI mapped address for this Octeon device. Provided by the host
00183         driver. */
00184     uint64_t                     bar0_addr;
00185 
00186     /** BAR1 PCI mapped address for this Octeon device. Provided by the host
00187         driver. */
00188     uint64_t                     bar1_addr;
00189 
00190 
00191 
00192     /** Application code (identifies type of app running on Octeon). */
00193     int                          app_code;
00194 
00195 #ifdef CN56XX_PEER_TO_PEER
00196     /** Number of endpoints that are peers to this Octeon device. */
00197     int                          max_peers;
00198 #endif
00199 
00200 } cvm_oct_dev_t;

00204 #define  cvm_oct_dev_get_chunk_ptr(oct, chunk_no)   \
00205     (chunk_no < oct->max_dma_qs)?(oct->chunk[chunk_no]):NULL)
